title: How true is the phrase, 'It’s not what you know, but who you know' in the tech industry? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what you want to achieve. If you’re talking about climbing the ladder and making money then it’s who you know. It matters very little what you know as long as you have connection. I’ve had so many employees and coworkers that doesn’t do crap at work but doesn’t get fired either because they know the right people. But if you’re talking about interpersonal ability and growth then it is about what you know. Cause it’s not about economic success but personal success.

In the extreme, let's imagine you know everything about tech and can't share it with anyone - not very valuable. Conversely, there is also little value in knowing everyone with nothing to contribute. They both matter, and things like how to network and get along with people (“soft skills") are a part of what you know. If you're weak in those areas, you can learn.
